author: Special Correspondent
text:
R. Rajendran, secretary of the Salem central district unit of DMK, submitting a petition to C. Vijaybabu (left), Returning Officer of the Salem North Assembly constituency, on Wednesday.- Photo: E. Lakshmi Narayanan

The Salem Central District unit of the Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) has presented a petition to the poll officials of the Salem North Assembly constituency seeking action against B. Valarmathi, State Minister, for her address in violation of the election code of conduct.

Petition

In a petition presented to C. Vijaybabu, Revenue Divisional Officer and Returning Officer of the Salem North Assembly constituency, here on Wednesday, R. Rajendran, Salem Central District secretary of the DMK, alleged that the Minister while addressing a public meeting in the city on March 17 used abusive language against the DMK chief M. Karunanidhi, M. K. Stalin and Kanimozhi, MP, in violation of poll code of conduct. As per the Election Commission norms, abusive language should not be used about individuals in public meetings, the petition said and demanded action against her.
title: Poll code violation complaint against Minister
